Posts.Content: blueyedgrl2121 wrote: I've been hanging around here for a few months and have posted a couple of times, but I have a question. Has anyone had an indented line on the areola? It kinds looks like the braided lines on the palm of your hand. (the best way I can describe it) It's under the nipple, only in my problem boob. I have no idea how long it's been there because I only recently started using a mirror doing my self checks. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Anyone with a similar line? blueyedgrl2121 blueyedgrl2121

Posts.Content: blueyedgrl2121 wrote: Wanted to share with anyone who's following along. Had my appointment with my primary dr about lump I found last week. She thinks it's nothing to worry about, but sending me a referral to a breast surgeon anyway. And she gave me copies of the radiologists report from mammo. 1.5 cm axillary lymph node, hypoechoic no increased vascularity, circumscribed margin. 6 cm fibroglandular tissue, no increased vascularity, global asymmetry. The only thing that worries me is I had never felt this lump before, and now it's there. So maybe it's larger now? Idk. I won't get the referral until next week, how long I'll have to wait. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Results day, good news blueyedgrl2121 blueyedgrl2121
